adjustments.title: Role in the Offense
adjustments.question: What was the defendant's role in the offense?

options.label: Organizer or leader of criminal activity involving 5+ participants or otherwise extensive
Manager or supervisor (not organizer/leader) of activity involving 5+ participants or otherwise extensive
Organizer, leader, manager, or supervisor of smaller criminal activity
No aggravating or mitigating role adjustment
Minor participant (limited role, less culpable than average participant)
Minimal participant (least culpable, limited knowledge of scope)

adjustments.title: Obstruction of Justice
adjustments.question: Did the defendant obstruct or impede the administration of justice during the investigation, prosecution, or sentencing of the instant offense?
adjustments.description: Examples include: threatening witnesses, destroying evidence, perjury, providing materially false information to officials, fleeing prosecution.

adjustments.title: Acceptance of Responsibility
adjustments.question: Did the defendant accept responsibility for the offense?

options.label: Yes - clearly demonstrated acceptance (2-level reduction)
options.note: Applies if defendant truthfully admits conduct, voluntary termination, etc.

options.label: Yes - acceptance with timely guilty plea (3-level reduction)
options.note: Additional 1-level requires: offense level 16+, government motion, timely notification of guilty plea

adjustments.incompatibilityNote: A defendant who obstructs justice is generally not entitled to acceptance of responsibility reduction

notes.obstruction_acceptance: Conduct resulting in an obstruction enhancement ordinarily indicates the defendant has not accepted responsibility. However, there may be extraordinary cases where adjustments for both apply.
notes.acceptance_timing: The 3-level reduction under §3E1.1(a) and (b) requires the offense level prior to the reduction to be 16 or greater.
notes.role_single_defendant: Role adjustments generally only apply when there are multiple participants. A defendant acting alone typically receives no role adjustment.
